Title: Real estate, NGOs fuel money laundering, says FG
Summary: The Federal Government has raised alarm over the growing use of real estate, non-governmental organisations (NGOs), and luxury goods as conduits for money laundering and other illicit financial activities in Nigeria . The Attorney-General of the Federation and Minister of Justice, Lateef Lateef, has raised the alarm .

Title: Morocco, Nigeria form company to develop $25 billion gas pipeline
Summary: Morocco and Nigeria have established a dedicated company to oversee the $25 billion Nigeria-Morocco Gas Pipeline project . Move aimed at accelerating construction and securing international financing . The announcement was confirmed by Amina Benkhadra, Director General of Morocco’s National Office .

Title: Bandits abduct Niger electoral commissioner, ex-SUBEB chair, motorists
Summary: Bandits have abducted Ahmed Mohammed, Commissioner Seven of the Niger State Independent Electoral Commission, popularly known as Barrister Ahmed Lawyer, along with his driver, former SUBEB Chairman Mohammed Bawa Niworu, and scores of motorists . The incident occurred in the early hours of Monday morning .

Title: How Gambia beats Nigeria, Ghana to jollof rice crown at WAFFEST 2025
Summary: The Gambia has emerged as the champion of jollof rice at the West African Food Festival (WAFFEST) 2025, held in Accra, Ghana . The festival is the largest annual culinary event in West Africa .

Title: Burna Boy, Rema, Wizkid top Spotify’s Afrobeats artistes list for 2025
Summary: Streaming platform Spotify has named Grammy-winning singer Burna Boy as its Top Afrobeats Artist of 2025 . The ranking placed Nigerian stars ahead of others across the globe . The list was released on Monday, September 29, 2025 .

Title: 10 countries where teachers are paid the most in 2025
Summary: Teaching salaries vary dramatically depending on where you live . In some countries, educators enjoy perks like housing, health insurance, and even tax-free income .

Title: Mandy Kiss unveiled as ambassador for Lagos anti-drug campaign
Summary: The move comes weeks after Mandy Kiss sparked public outrage with a controversial social media post where she claimed she planned to engage in a marathon sex act with 100 men in a single day .

Title: FRSC loses five officers to reckless drivers in September
Summary: Federal Road Safety Corps has confirmed the death of five of its officers in September 2025 . FRSC officers were knocked down by reckless drivers while on duty .

Title: Nigeria’s worst days are over – Tinubu
Summary: President Bola Ahmed Tinubu has declared that Nigeria’s most difficult days are behind it . He said citizens that the country is on the path to sustained progress .

Title: Nigeria, Russia move to boost trade, investment through BRICS alliance
Summary: Nigeria and Russia are set to strengthen bilateral relations through the platform of the BRICS Women’s Business Alliance (WBA) Nigeria, Russia and other members of the world's emerging superpowers will join the alliance .
